insights.title: Running Volume -> Iron
insights.headline: Daily Run Km affects iron total with a threshold effect
insights.explanation: Foot-strike hemolysis destroys red blood cells; iron lost via hemolysis, sweat, and GI ischemia. The effect intensifies above 177.2 km/month (-0.30 mcg/dL per unit vs -0.05 below).
insights.whyNow: Current value (56.4) is below the threshold (177.2 km/month).
insights.showWork: Piecewise-linear model: iron_total_smoothed ~ f(daily_run_km) with changepoint at theta. Theta = 177.2 km/month. Below theta: -0.053 per unit. Above theta: -0.298 per unit. Fitted on 452 data points (effective N = 2). Evidence split: 5% personal / 95% population. Prior source: Sim et al., Sports Med 2019 (evidence tier: meta-analysis/RCT).
insights.mechanism: Foot-strike hemolysis destroys red blood cells; iron lost via hemolysis, sweat, and GI ischemia
insights.priorSource: Sim et al., Sports Med 2019

insights.title: Running Volume -> Ferritin
insights.headline: Daily Run Km affects ferritin with a threshold effect
insights.explanation: Chronic endurance running depletes iron stores through multiple loss pathways. The effect intensifies above 127.5 km/month (+0.15 ng/mL per unit vs +0.07 below).
insights.whyNow: Current value (56.4) is below the threshold (127.5 km/month).
insights.showWork: Piecewise-linear model: ferritin_smoothed ~ f(daily_run_km) with changepoint at theta. Theta = 127.5 km/month. Below theta: +0.070 per unit. Above theta: +0.147 per unit. Fitted on 452 data points (effective N = 2). Evidence split: 5% personal / 95% population. Prior source: Peeling et al., IJSNEM 2008; male-specific: no menstrual loss variance (evidence tier: observational).
insights.mechanism: Chronic endurance running depletes iron stores through multiple loss pathways
insights.priorSource: Peeling et al., IJSNEM 2008; male-specific: no menstrual loss variance

insights.title: Running Volume -> Hemoglobin
insights.headline: Daily Run Km affects hemoglobin with a threshold effect
insights.explanation: Iron depletion impairs hemoglobin synthesis; chronic running can cause sports anemia.
insights.whyNow: Current value (56.4) is below the threshold (156.4 km/month).
insights.showWork: Piecewise-linear model: hemoglobin_smoothed ~ f(daily_run_km) with changepoint at theta. Theta = 156.4 km/month. Below theta: -0.003 per unit. Above theta: -0.005 per unit. Fitted on 618 data points (effective N = 4). Evidence split: 5% personal / 95% population. Prior source: Mairbäurl, Front Physiol 2013; Eichner, Am J Med 1985 (evidence tier: observational).
insights.mechanism: Iron depletion impairs hemoglobin synthesis; chronic running can cause sports anemia
insights.priorSource: Mairbäurl, Front Physiol 2013; Eichner, Am J Med 1985

insights.title: Training Hours -> Testosterone
insights.headline: Daily Duration Min affects testosterone with a threshold effect
insights.explanation: Overtraining suppresses the hypothalamic-pituitary-gonadal axis. Most of the effect occurs below 1272.9 min/month (+1.39 ng/dL per unit), with diminishing returns above.
insights.whyNow: Current value (313.5) is below the threshold (1272.9 min/month).
insights.showWork: Piecewise-linear model: testosterone_smoothed ~ f(daily_duration_min) with changepoint at theta. Theta = 1272.9 min/month. Below theta: +1.394 per unit. Above theta: +0.479 per unit. Fitted on 830 data points (effective N = 3). Evidence split: 5% personal / 95% population. Prior source: Hackney et al., BJSM 2003; EHMC male convergence narrows variance (evidence tier: observational).
insights.mechanism: Overtraining suppresses the hypothalamic-pituitary-gonadal axis
insights.priorSource: Hackney et al., BJSM 2003; EHMC male convergence narrows variance

insights.title: Training Hours -> Cortisol
insights.headline: Daily Duration Min affects cortisol with a threshold effect
insights.explanation: Chronic training stress elevates baseline cortisol via HPA axis activation. Most of the effect occurs below 1205.9 min/month (+0.02 mcg/dL per unit), with diminishing returns above.
insights.whyNow: Current value (313.5) is below the threshold (1205.9 min/month).
insights.showWork: Piecewise-linear model: cortisol_smoothed ~ f(daily_duration_min) with changepoint at theta. Theta = 1205.9 min/month. Below theta: +0.021 per unit. Above theta: -0.003 per unit. Fitted on 450 data points (effective N = 2). Evidence split: 6% personal / 94% population. Prior source: Hackney et al., BJSM 2003; Cadegiani & Kater, BMC Sports Sci Med Rehabil 2017 (evidence tier: observational).
insights.mechanism: Chronic training stress elevates baseline cortisol via HPA axis activation
insights.priorSource: Hackney et al., BJSM 2003; Cadegiani & Kater, BMC Sports Sci Med Rehabil 2017

insights.title: Zone 2 Volume -> Triglycerides
insights.headline: Daily Zone2 Min affects triglycerides with a threshold effect
insights.explanation: Aerobic exercise increases lipoprotein lipase activity, clearing triglycerides.
insights.whyNow: Threshold identified at 208.7 min/month from available data.
insights.showWork: Piecewise-linear model: triglycerides_smoothed ~ f(daily_zone2_min) with changepoint at theta. Theta = 208.7 min/month. Below theta: +0.074 per unit. Above theta: -0.090 per unit. Fitted on 618 data points (effective N = 4). Evidence split: 6% personal / 94% population. Prior source: AHA Physical Activity Guidelines; male TG response less variable (evidence tier: meta-analysis/RCT).
insights.mechanism: Aerobic exercise increases lipoprotein lipase activity, clearing triglycerides
insights.priorSource: AHA Physical Activity Guidelines; male TG response less variable

insights.title: Zone 2 Volume -> HDL
insights.headline: Daily Zone2 Min affects hdl with a threshold effect
insights.explanation: Regular aerobic exercise upregulates HDL production and reverse cholesterol transport. The effect intensifies above 139.3 min/month (-0.10 mg/dL per unit vs -0.01 below).
insights.whyNow: Threshold identified at 139.3 min/month from available data.
insights.showWork: Piecewise-linear model: hdl_smoothed ~ f(daily_zone2_min) with changepoint at theta. Theta = 139.3 min/month. Below theta: -0.012 per unit. Above theta: -0.099 per unit. Fitted on 618 data points (effective N = 4). Evidence split: 5% personal / 95% population. Prior source: AHA Guidelines; Kodama et al. 2007 n=83,681 male-stratified 2x HDL effect (evidence tier: meta-analysis/RCT).
insights.mechanism: Regular aerobic exercise upregulates HDL production and reverse cholesterol transport
insights.priorSource: AHA Guidelines; Kodama et al. 2007 n=83,681 male-stratified 2x HDL effect

insights.title: Zone 2 Volume -> LDL
insights.headline: Daily Zone2 Min affects ldl with a threshold effect
insights.explanation: Aerobic exercise can modestly reduce LDL and shift particle size from small-dense to large-buoyant.
insights.whyNow: Threshold identified at 201.8 min/month from available data.
insights.showWork: Piecewise-linear model: ldl_smoothed ~ f(daily_zone2_min) with changepoint at theta. Theta = 201.8 min/month. Below theta: -0.194 per unit. Above theta: +0.213 per unit. Fitted on 618 data points (effective N = 4). Evidence split: 5% personal / 95% population. Prior source: Mann et al., J Lipid Res 2014; Kelley et al., Atherosclerosis 2012 (evidence tier: meta-analysis/RCT).
insights.mechanism: Aerobic exercise can modestly reduce LDL and shift particle size from small-dense to large-buoyant
insights.priorSource: Mann et al., J Lipid Res 2014; Kelley et al., Atherosclerosis 2012

insights.title: ACWR -> Inflammation
insights.headline: Acwr affects hscrp with a threshold effect
insights.explanation: Acute overreaching triggers systemic inflammation via muscle damage and oxidative stress. Most of the effect occurs below 1.0 ratio (+0.17 mg/L per unit), with diminishing returns above.
insights.whyNow: Current value (0.9) is below the threshold (1.0 ratio).
insights.showWork: Piecewise-linear model: hscrp_smoothed ~ f(acwr) with changepoint at theta. Theta = 1.0 ratio. Below theta: +0.175 per unit. Above theta: -0.002 per unit. Fitted on 4 data points (effective N = 4). Evidence split: 5% personal / 95% population. Prior source: Hulin et al., BJSM 2016 (evidence tier: meta-analysis/RCT).
insights.mechanism: Acute overreaching triggers systemic inflammation via muscle damage and oxidative stress
insights.priorSource: Hulin et al., BJSM 2016

insights.title: ACWR -> Resting HR Trend
insights.headline: Acwr affects resting hr 7d mean with a threshold effect
insights.explanation: Chronic overreaching elevates baseline sympathetic tone and resting heart rate. Most of the effect occurs below 1.8 ratio (-4.34 bpm per unit), with diminishing returns above.
insights.whyNow: Current value (0.9) is below the threshold (1.8 ratio).
insights.showWork: Piecewise-linear model: resting_hr_7d_mean ~ f(acwr) with changepoint at theta. Theta = 1.8 ratio. Below theta: -4.338 per unit. Above theta: +0.486 per unit. Fitted on 2400 data points (effective N = 342). Evidence split: 28% personal / 72% population. Prior source: Hulin et al., BJSM 2016; Gabbett, BJSM 2016 (evidence tier: meta-analysis/RCT).
insights.mechanism: Chronic overreaching elevates baseline sympathetic tone and resting heart rate
insights.priorSource: Hulin et al., BJSM 2016; Gabbett, BJSM 2016

insights.title: Training Consistency -> VO2peak
insights.headline: Increasing training consistency could improve vo2 peak
insights.recommendation: Increase toward 0.8 fraction for maximum benefit.
insights.explanation: Consistent aerobic training drives mitochondrial biogenesis and cardiac remodeling. Most of the effect occurs below 0.8 fraction (+23.30 ml/min/kg per unit), with diminishing returns above.
insights.whyNow: Current value (0.3) is below the threshold (0.8 fraction).
insights.suggestedAction: Increase toward 0.8 fraction for maximum benefit.
insights.showWork: Piecewise-linear model: vo2_peak_smoothed ~ f(training_consistency) with changepoint at theta. Theta = 0.8 fraction. Below theta: +23.303 per unit. Above theta: +0.644 per unit. Fitted on 1718 data points (effective N = 20). Evidence split: 27% personal / 73% population. Prior source: General exercise physiology (evidence tier: mechanistic).
insights.mechanism: Consistent aerobic training drives mitochondrial biogenesis and cardiac remodeling
insights.priorSource: General exercise physiology

insights.title: Ferritin -> VO2peak
insights.headline: Ferritin affects vo2 peak with a threshold effect
insights.explanation: Iron stores limit oxygen transport capacity via hemoglobin synthesis.
insights.whyNow: Current value (46.0) is above the threshold (35.6 ng/mL).
insights.showWork: Piecewise-linear model: vo2_peak_smoothed ~ f(ferritin_smoothed) with changepoint at theta. Theta = 35.6 ng/mL. Below theta: +0.230 per unit. Above theta: +0.122 per unit. Fitted on 452 data points (effective N = 20). Evidence split: 15% personal / 85% population. Prior source: DellaValle & Haas, MSSE 2014 (evidence tier: observational).
insights.mechanism: Iron stores limit oxygen transport capacity via hemoglobin synthesis
insights.priorSource: DellaValle & Haas, MSSE 2014

insights.title: Workout Time -> Sleep Efficiency
insights.headline: Last Workout End Hour affects sleep efficiency pct with a threshold effect
insights.explanation: Late workouts elevate core temperature and sympathetic tone, delaying sleep onset. The effect intensifies above 19.7 hour (-2.02 % per unit vs -0.06 below).
insights.whyNow: Current value (15.7) is below the threshold (19.7 hour).
insights.showWork: Piecewise-linear model: sleep_efficiency_pct ~ f(last_workout_end_hour) with changepoint at theta. Theta = 19.7 hour. Below theta: -0.063 per unit. Above theta: -2.023 per unit. Fitted on 1181 data points (effective N = 393). Evidence split: 34% personal / 66% population. Prior source: Stutz et al., Sports Med 2019; Frimpong et al., Sleep Med Rev 2021 (evidence tier: meta-analysis/RCT).
insights.mechanism: Late workouts elevate core temperature and sympathetic tone, delaying sleep onset
insights.priorSource: Stutz et al., Sports Med 2019; Frimpong et al., Sleep Med Rev 2021

insights.title: Bedtime -> Sleep Quality
insights.headline: Bedtime Hour affects sleep quality score with a threshold effect
insights.explanation: Later bedtimes misalign with circadian melatonin onset, reducing sleep architecture quality.
insights.whyNow: Threshold identified at 24.4 hour from available data.
insights.showWork: Piecewise-linear model: sleep_quality_score ~ f(bedtime_hour) with changepoint at theta. Theta = 24.4 hour. Below theta: +3.090 per unit. Above theta: -2.396 per unit. Fitted on 1181 data points (effective N = 393). Evidence split: 34% personal / 66% population. Prior source: Faust et al., npj Digital Medicine 2020; circadian DLMO literature (evidence tier: observational).
insights.mechanism: Later bedtimes misalign with circadian melatonin onset, reducing sleep architecture quality
insights.priorSource: Faust et al., npj Digital Medicine 2020; circadian DLMO literature

insights.title: Bedtime -> Deep Sleep
insights.headline: Bedtime Hour affects deep sleep min with a threshold effect
insights.explanation: Earlier bedtime captures more slow-wave sleep in the first half of the night.
insights.whyNow: Threshold identified at 24.4 hour from available data.
insights.showWork: Piecewise-linear model: deep_sleep_min ~ f(bedtime_hour) with changepoint at theta. Theta = 24.4 hour. Below theta: +1.368 per unit. Above theta: -1.474 per unit. Fitted on 1136 data points (effective N = 378). Evidence split: 32% personal / 68% population. Prior source: Faust et al., npj Digital Medicine 2020; circadian DLMO literature (evidence tier: observational).
insights.mechanism: Earlier bedtime captures more slow-wave sleep in the first half of the night
insights.priorSource: Faust et al., npj Digital Medicine 2020; circadian DLMO literature

insights.title: Sleep Duration -> Next-Day HRV
insights.headline: Sleep Duration Hrs affects hrv daily mean with a threshold effect
insights.recommendation: Sweet spot near 6.8 hours. Both too little and too much are suboptimal.
insights.explanation: Adequate sleep restores parasympathetic tone; insufficient sleep elevates sympathetic activity. The effect intensifies above 6.8 hours (-0.38 ms per unit vs +0.12 below).
insights.whyNow: Current value (7.5) is above the threshold (6.8 hours).
insights.suggestedAction: Sweet spot near 6.8 hours. Both too little and too much are suboptimal.
insights.showWork: Piecewise-linear model: hrv_daily_mean ~ f(sleep_duration_hrs) with changepoint at theta. Theta = 6.8 hours. Below theta: +0.116 per unit. Above theta: -0.381 per unit. Fitted on 2204 data points (effective N = 734). Evidence split: 99% personal / 1% population. Prior source: Zhang et al., Front Neurol 2025 (meta-analysis); Lastella et al. 2015 (evidence tier: meta-analysis/RCT).
insights.mechanism: Adequate sleep restores parasympathetic tone; insufficient sleep elevates sympathetic activity
insights.priorSource: Zhang et al., Front Neurol 2025 (meta-analysis); Lastella et al. 2015

insights.title: Sleep Debt -> Resting HR
insights.headline: Sleep Debt 14D affects resting hr with a threshold effect
insights.explanation: Accumulated sleep deficit elevates sympathetic tone and baseline heart rate. Most of the effect occurs below 4.2 hours deficit (+0.05 bpm per unit), with diminishing returns above.
insights.whyNow: Threshold identified at 4.2 hours deficit from available data.
insights.showWork: Piecewise-linear model: resting_hr ~ f(sleep_debt_14d) with changepoint at theta. Theta = 4.2 hours deficit. Below theta: +0.051 per unit. Above theta: -0.024 per unit. Fitted on 1181 data points (effective N = 393). Evidence split: 34% personal / 66% population. Prior source: Spiegel et al., Lancet 1999; PMC10543608 sleep restriction study (evidence tier: meta-analysis/RCT).
insights.mechanism: Accumulated sleep deficit elevates sympathetic tone and baseline heart rate
insights.priorSource: Spiegel et al., Lancet 1999; PMC10543608 sleep restriction study

insights.title: Daily Training Load -> Next-Day HRV
insights.headline: Daily Trimp affects hrv daily mean with a threshold effect
insights.explanation: Acute training load drives autonomic nervous system fatigue measured via HRV depression. The effect intensifies above 80.2 TRIMP (-0.14 ms per unit vs +0.06 below).
insights.whyNow: Threshold identified at 80.2 TRIMP from available data.
insights.showWork: Piecewise-linear model: hrv_daily_mean ~ f(daily_trimp) with changepoint at theta. Theta = 80.2 TRIMP. Below theta: +0.057 per unit. Above theta: -0.142 per unit. Fitted on 2391 data points (effective N = 797). Evidence split: 86% personal / 14% population. Prior source: Stanley et al., Sports Med 2013; Buchheit 2014; trained male CV narrowing (evidence tier: meta-analysis/RCT).
insights.mechanism: Acute training load drives autonomic nervous system fatigue measured via HRV depression
insights.priorSource: Stanley et al., Sports Med 2013; Buchheit 2014; trained male CV narrowing

insights.title: Daily Training Load -> Next-Day Resting HR
insights.headline: Daily Trimp affects resting hr with a threshold effect
insights.explanation: Acute training elevates next-day resting HR via sympathetic activation and cardiac fatigue. The effect intensifies above 0.0 TRIMP (-0.39 bpm per unit vs -0.03 below).
insights.whyNow: Threshold identified at 0.0 TRIMP from available data.
insights.showWork: Piecewise-linear model: resting_hr ~ f(daily_trimp) with changepoint at theta. Theta = 0.0 TRIMP. Below theta: -0.025 per unit. Above theta: -0.388 per unit. Fitted on 2371 data points (effective N = 790). Evidence split: 85% personal / 15% population. Prior source: Stanley et al., Sports Med 2013; Buchheit, Front Physiol 2014 (evidence tier: meta-analysis/RCT).
insights.mechanism: Acute training elevates next-day resting HR via sympathetic activation and cardiac fatigue
insights.priorSource: Stanley et al., Sports Med 2013; Buchheit, Front Physiol 2014

insights.title: Daily Steps -> Sleep Efficiency
insights.headline: Steps affects sleep efficiency pct with a threshold effect
insights.explanation: Moderate daily activity promotes sleep; excessive activity may impair it via overarousal.
insights.whyNow: Current value (16348.1) is above the threshold (9901.9 steps).
insights.showWork: Piecewise-linear model: sleep_efficiency_pct ~ f(steps) with changepoint at theta. Theta = 9901.9 steps. Below theta: +0.000 per unit. Above theta: -0.000 per unit. Fitted on 1181 data points (effective N = 393). Evidence split: 34% personal / 66% population. Prior source: Kredlow et al., J Behav Med 2015; PMC7735606 (evidence tier: meta-analysis/RCT).
insights.mechanism: Moderate daily activity promotes sleep; excessive activity may impair it via overarousal
insights.priorSource: Kredlow et al., J Behav Med 2015; PMC7735606

insights.title: Active Energy -> Deep Sleep
insights.headline: Active Energy Kcal affects deep sleep min with a threshold effect
insights.explanation: Physical activity increases slow-wave sleep need via adenosine accumulation and thermoregulation.
insights.whyNow: Current value (1101.8) is above the threshold (503.4 kcal).
insights.showWork: Piecewise-linear model: deep_sleep_min ~ f(active_energy_kcal) with changepoint at theta. Theta = 503.4 kcal. Below theta: +0.004 per unit. Above theta: +0.008 per unit. Fitted on 1136 data points (effective N = 378). Evidence split: 32% personal / 68% population. Prior source: Kline, Am J Lifestyle Med 2014; Stutz et al., Sports Med 2019 (evidence tier: meta-analysis/RCT).
insights.mechanism: Physical activity increases slow-wave sleep need via adenosine accumulation and thermoregulation
insights.priorSource: Kline, Am J Lifestyle Med 2014; Stutz et al., Sports Med 2019

insights.title: Training Duration -> Sleep Efficiency
insights.headline: Daily Duration Min affects sleep efficiency pct with a threshold effect
insights.explanation: Moderate exercise promotes sleep onset and consolidation via thermoregulatory and adenosine pathways. The effect intensifies above 49.1 min (-0.10 % per unit vs +0.04 below).
insights.whyNow: Threshold identified at 49.1 min from available data.
insights.showWork: Piecewise-linear model: sleep_efficiency_pct ~ f(daily_duration_min) with changepoint at theta. Theta = 49.1 min. Below theta: +0.036 per unit. Above theta: -0.104 per unit. Fitted on 1181 data points (effective N = 393). Evidence split: 34% personal / 66% population. Prior source: Kredlow et al., J Behav Med 2015; Stutz et al., Sports Med 2019 (evidence tier: meta-analysis/RCT).
insights.mechanism: Moderate exercise promotes sleep onset and consolidation via thermoregulatory and adenosine pathways

insights.title: Training Duration -> Deep Sleep
insights.headline: Daily Duration Min affects deep sleep min with a threshold effect
insights.explanation: Exercise increases slow-wave sleep need proportional to volume via adenosine accumulation.
insights.whyNow: Threshold identified at 68.0 min from available data.
insights.showWork: Piecewise-linear model: deep_sleep_min ~ f(daily_duration_min) with changepoint at theta. Theta = 68.0 min. Below theta: +0.856 per unit. Above theta: -0.439 per unit. Fitted on 1136 data points (effective N = 378). Evidence split: 32% personal / 68% population. Prior source: Kline, Am J Lifestyle Med 2014; Driver & Taylor, Sleep Med Rev 2000 (evidence tier: meta-analysis/RCT).
insights.mechanism: Exercise increases slow-wave sleep need proportional to volume via adenosine accumulation
insights.priorSource: Kline, Am J Lifestyle Med 2014; Driver & Taylor, Sleep Med Rev 2000

insights.title: Training Load -> Sleep Efficiency
insights.headline: Daily Trimp affects sleep efficiency pct with a threshold effect
insights.explanation: High-intensity training elevates sympathetic tone and core temperature, impairing sleep efficiency at high loads. The effect intensifies above 35.1 TRIMP (+0.27 % per unit vs -0.06 below).
insights.whyNow: Threshold identified at 35.1 TRIMP from available data.
insights.showWork: Piecewise-linear model: sleep_efficiency_pct ~ f(daily_trimp) with changepoint at theta. Theta = 35.1 TRIMP. Below theta: -0.061 per unit. Above theta: +0.270 per unit. Fitted on 1181 data points (effective N = 393). Evidence split: 34% personal / 66% population. Prior source: Killer et al., Eur J Appl Physiol 2017; Myllymäki et al., JSAMS 2011 (evidence tier: observational).
insights.mechanism: High-intensity training elevates sympathetic tone and core temperature, impairing sleep efficiency at high loads
insights.priorSource: Killer et al., Eur J Appl Physiol 2017; Myllymäki et al., JSAMS 2011

insights.title: Training Load -> Deep Sleep
insights.headline: Daily Trimp affects deep sleep min with a threshold effect
insights.explanation: Training intensity drives deep sleep need but extreme loads suppress SWS via cortisol and sympathetic activation.
insights.whyNow: Threshold identified at 37.2 TRIMP from available data.
insights.showWork: Piecewise-linear model: deep_sleep_min ~ f(daily_trimp) with changepoint at theta. Theta = 37.2 TRIMP. Below theta: +0.195 per unit. Above theta: +0.156 per unit. Fitted on 1136 data points (effective N = 378). Evidence split: 32% personal / 68% population. Prior source: Killer et al., Eur J Appl Physiol 2017; Vitale et al., IJSPP 2019 (evidence tier: observational).
insights.mechanism: Training intensity drives deep sleep need but extreme loads suppress SWS via cortisol and sympathetic activation
insights.priorSource: Killer et al., Eur J Appl Physiol 2017; Vitale et al., IJSPP 2019

insights.title: Running Volume -> Sleep Efficiency
insights.headline: Daily Run Km affects sleep efficiency pct with a threshold effect
insights.explanation: Aerobic running improves sleep quality via cardiovascular and thermoregulatory mechanisms. The effect intensifies above 6.5 km (-0.28 % per unit vs +0.06 below).
insights.whyNow: Threshold identified at 6.5 km from available data.
insights.showWork: Piecewise-linear model: sleep_efficiency_pct ~ f(daily_run_km) with changepoint at theta. Theta = 6.5 km. Below theta: +0.060 per unit. Above theta: -0.281 per unit. Fitted on 1181 data points (effective N = 393). Evidence split: 34% personal / 66% population. Prior source: Kredlow et al., J Behav Med 2015; Youngstedt, Med Sci Sports Exerc 2005 (evidence tier: meta-analysis/RCT).
insights.mechanism: Aerobic running improves sleep quality via cardiovascular and thermoregulatory mechanisms
insights.priorSource: Kredlow et al., J Behav Med 2015; Youngstedt, Med Sci Sports Exerc 2005

insights.title: Weekly Volume -> HRV Baseline
insights.headline: Daily Run Km affects hrv 7d mean with a threshold effect
insights.recommendation: Sweet spot near 25.9 km/week. Both too little and too much are suboptimal.
insights.explanation: Moderate volume improves vagal tone; excessive volume suppresses it via overtraining. Most of the effect occurs below 25.9 km/week (+0.18 ms per unit), with diminishing returns above.
insights.whyNow: Threshold identified at 25.9 km/week from available data.
insights.suggestedAction: Sweet spot near 25.9 km/week. Both too little and too much are suboptimal.
insights.showWork: Piecewise-linear model: hrv_7d_mean ~ f(daily_run_km) with changepoint at theta. Theta = 25.9 km/week. Below theta: +0.177 per unit. Above theta: -0.008 per unit. Fitted on 2401 data points (effective N = 343). Evidence split: 28% personal / 72% population. Prior source: Plews et al., Sports Med 2013; Buchheit 2014; trained male CV narrowing (evidence tier: meta-analysis/RCT).
insights.mechanism: Moderate volume improves vagal tone; excessive volume suppresses it via overtraining
insights.priorSource: Plews et al., Sports Med 2013; Buchheit 2014; trained male CV narrowing

insights.title: Travel Load -> Sleep Efficiency
insights.headline: Travel Load affects sleep efficiency pct with a threshold effect
insights.recommendation: Sweet spot near 0.6 jet lag score. Both too little and too much are suboptimal.
insights.explanation: Jet lag disrupts circadian rhythm, delaying melatonin onset and reducing sleep efficiency. The effect intensifies above 0.6 jet lag score (-29.99 % per unit vs +4.07 below).
insights.whyNow: Threshold identified at 0.6 jet lag score from available data.
insights.suggestedAction: Sweet spot near 0.6 jet lag score. Both too little and too much are suboptimal.
insights.showWork: Piecewise-linear model: sleep_efficiency_pct ~ f(travel_load) with changepoint at theta. Theta = 0.6 jet lag score. Below theta: +4.065 per unit. Above theta: -29.991 per unit. Fitted on 1181 data points (effective N = 393). Evidence split: 99% personal / 1% population. Prior source: Dunican et al. 2023; Fowler et al. MSSE 2017; Oura/NUS SLEEP 2025 (evidence tier: observational).
insights.mechanism: Jet lag disrupts circadian rhythm, delaying melatonin onset and reducing sleep efficiency
insights.priorSource: Dunican et al. 2023; Fowler et al. MSSE 2017; Oura/NUS SLEEP 2025

insights.title: Travel Load -> Daily HRV
insights.headline: Travel Load affects hrv daily mean with a threshold effect
insights.recommendation: Threshold identified at -0.0 jet lag score.
insights.explanation: Travel stress and circadian misalignment suppress parasympathetic tone measured via HRV. The effect intensifies above -0.0 jet lag score (+1.96 ms per unit vs +0.35 below).
insights.whyNow: Threshold identified at -0.0 jet lag score from available data.
insights.suggestedAction: Threshold identified at -0.0 jet lag score.
insights.showWork: Piecewise-linear model: hrv_daily_mean ~ f(travel_load) with changepoint at theta. Theta = -0.0 jet lag score. Below theta: +0.355 per unit. Above theta: +1.963 per unit. Fitted on 2384 data points (effective N = 794). Evidence split: 99% personal / 1% population. Prior source: Morris et al. PNAS 2016; Grimaldi et al. Hypertension 2016 (evidence tier: observational).
insights.mechanism: Travel stress and circadian misalignment suppress parasympathetic tone measured via HRV
insights.priorSource: Morris et al. PNAS 2016; Grimaldi et al. Hypertension 2016

insights.title: Travel Load -> Resting HR
insights.headline: Travel Load affects resting hr with a threshold effect
insights.recommendation: Threshold identified at -0.0 jet lag score.
insights.explanation: Circadian disruption and travel fatigue elevate sympathetic tone and resting heart rate. The effect intensifies above -0.0 jet lag score (-3.58 bpm per unit vs +0.10 below).
insights.whyNow: Threshold identified at -0.0 jet lag score from available data.
insights.suggestedAction: Threshold identified at -0.0 jet lag score.
insights.showWork: Piecewise-linear model: resting_hr ~ f(travel_load) with changepoint at theta. Theta = -0.0 jet lag score. Below theta: +0.096 per unit. Above theta: -3.576 per unit. Fitted on 2364 data points (effective N = 788). Evidence split: 85% personal / 15% population. Prior source: Morris et al. PNAS 2016; Grimaldi et al. Hypertension 2016 (evidence tier: observational).
insights.mechanism: Circadian disruption and travel fatigue elevate sympathetic tone and resting heart rate
insights.priorSource: Morris et al. PNAS 2016; Grimaldi et al. Hypertension 2016

insights.title: Training Volume -> Body Fat

insights.explanation: Higher training volume increases energy expenditure and fat oxidation.

ACSM 2009; JAMA Network Open meta-analysis 2024 (evidence tier: meta-analysis/RCT).

insights.showWork: Piecewise-linear model: body_mass_kg ~ f(steps) with changepoint at theta. Theta = 13101.3 steps. Below theta: -0.024 per unit. Above theta: +0.005 per unit. insights.priorSource: Richardson et al. Ann Intern Med 2008; Dwyer et al. BMJ 2011

insights.priorSource: Mairbäurl, Front Physiol 2013; plasma expansion dilution

insights.recommendation: Sweet spot near 1.2 ratio. Both too little and too much are suboptimal.

insights.suggestedAction: Sweet spot near 1.2 ratio. Both too little and too much are suboptimal.

insights.priorSource: Simpson et al. Exerc Immunol Rev 2020; stress neutrophilia

insights.title: Ferritin -> Hemoglobin
insights.headline: Your ferritin is at the sweet spot for hemoglobin
insights.recommendation: Current level is optimal. Maintain near 45.7 ng/mL.
insights.explanation: Low ferritin limits iron availability for hemoglobin synthesis. Most of the effect occurs below 45.7 ng/mL (-0.05 g/dL per unit), with diminishing returns above.
insights.whyNow: Current value (46.0) is near the optimal range (45.7 ng/mL).
insights.suggestedAction: Current level is optimal. Maintain near 45.7 ng/mL.
insights.showWork: Piecewise-linear model: hemoglobin_smoothed ~ f(ferritin_smoothed) with changepoint at theta. Theta = 45.7 ng/mL. Below theta: -0.053 per unit. Above theta: -0.002 per unit. Fitted on 2 data points (effective N = 4). Evidence split: 5% personal / 95% population. Prior source: DellaValle & Haas MSSE 2014; iron stores → Hb synthesis (evidence tier: observational).
insights.mechanism: Low ferritin limits iron availability for hemoglobin synthesis
insights.priorSource: DellaValle & Haas MSSE 2014; iron stores → Hb synthesis

insights.title: Homocysteine -> hsCRP
insights.headline: Homocysteine affects hscrp with a threshold effect
insights.explanation: Elevated homocysteine promotes endothelial dysfunction and vascular inflammation.
insights.whyNow: Current value (7.7) is below the threshold (8.1 umol/L).
insights.showWork: Piecewise-linear model: hscrp_smoothed ~ f(homocysteine_smoothed) with changepoint at theta. Theta = 8.1 umol/L. Below theta: -0.004 per unit. Above theta: -0.008 per unit. Fitted on 618 data points (effective N = 4). Evidence split: 7% personal / 93% population. Prior source: Ganguly & Alam, Nutr J 2015; vascular inflammation — wide prior (evidence tier: mechanistic).
insights.mechanism: Elevated homocysteine promotes endothelial dysfunction and vascular inflammation
insights.priorSource: Ganguly & Alam, Nutr J 2015; vascular inflammation — wide prior

insights.title: Dietary Protein -> Body Fat
insights.headline: Dietary Protein G affects body fat pct with a threshold effect
insights.explanation: Higher protein intake increases thermic effect and satiety, supporting fat loss. The effect intensifies above 42.1 g (+0.00 % per unit vs +0.00 below).
insights.whyNow: Threshold identified at 42.1 g from available data.
insights.showWork: Piecewise-linear model: body_fat_pct ~ f(dietary_protein_g) with changepoint at theta. Theta = 42.1 g. Below theta: +0.000 per unit. Above theta: +0.001 per unit. Fitted on 28 data points (effective N = 20). Evidence split: 27% personal / 73% population. Prior source: Wycherley et al. Am J Clin Nutr 2012; thermic effect — wide prior (evidence tier: meta-analysis/RCT).
insights.mechanism: Higher protein intake increases thermic effect and satiety, supporting fat loss
insights.priorSource: Wycherley et al. Am J Clin Nutr 2012; thermic effect — wide prior

insights.title: Dietary Energy -> Body Mass
insights.headline: Dietary Energy Kcal affects body mass kg with a threshold effect
insights.explanation: Chronic energy surplus/deficit drives body mass changes via energy balance. Most of the effect occurs below 1121.7 kcal (-0.02 kg per unit), with diminishing returns above.
insights.whyNow: Threshold identified at 1121.7 kcal from available data.
insights.showWork: Piecewise-linear model: body_mass_kg ~ f(dietary_energy_kcal) with changepoint at theta. Theta = 1121.7 kcal. Below theta: -0.023 per unit. Above theta: -0.001 per unit. Fitted on 29 data points (effective N = 20). Evidence split: 5% personal / 95% population. Prior source: Hall et al. Lancet 2011; energy balance model — very wide prior (evidence tier: meta-analysis/RCT).
insights.mechanism: Chronic energy surplus/deficit drives body mass changes via energy balance
insights.priorSource: Hall et al. Lancet 2011; energy balance model — very wide prior

insights.title: Travel Load -> NLR
insights.headline: Travel Load affects nlr with a threshold effect
insights.recommendation: Threshold identified at 0.5 jet lag score.
insights.explanation: Travel stress and circadian disruption shift immune balance toward neutrophilia. The effect intensifies above 0.5 jet lag score (+0.02 ratio per unit vs +0.00 below).
insights.whyNow: Threshold identified at 0.5 jet lag score from available data.
insights.suggestedAction: Threshold identified at 0.5 jet lag score.
insights.showWork: Piecewise-linear model: nlr ~ f(travel_load) with changepoint at theta. Theta = 0.5 jet lag score. Below theta: +0.003 per unit. Above theta: +0.019 per unit. Fitted on 611 data points (effective N = 87). Evidence split: 99% personal / 1% population. Prior source: Morris et al. PNAS 2016; circadian disruption immune shift (evidence tier: observational).
insights.mechanism: Travel stress and circadian disruption shift immune balance toward neutrophilia
insights.priorSource: Morris et al. PNAS 2016; circadian disruption immune shift

insights.title: Travel Load -> Deep Sleep
insights.headline: Travel Load affects deep sleep min with a threshold effect
insights.recommendation: Sweet spot near 0.6 jet lag score. Both too little and too much are suboptimal.
insights.explanation: Jet lag disrupts slow-wave sleep architecture via circadian misalignment.
insights.whyNow: Threshold identified at 0.6 jet lag score from available data.
insights.suggestedAction: Sweet spot near 0.6 jet lag score. Both too little and too much are suboptimal.
insights.showWork: Piecewise-linear model: deep_sleep_min ~ f(travel_load) with changepoint at theta. Theta = 0.6 jet lag score. Below theta: +36.668 per unit. Above theta: -58.612 per unit. Fitted on 1136 data points (effective N = 378). Evidence split: 32% personal / 68% population. Prior source: Dunican et al. 2023; jet lag SWS disruption (evidence tier: observational).
insights.mechanism: Jet lag disrupts slow-wave sleep architecture via circadian misalignment
insights.priorSource: Dunican et al. 2023; jet lag SWS disruption
